name: Enterprise Mobile
details: Enterprise Mobile

questions.description: Please answer a few basic questions about your project. You can also provide the needed information in a supporting document--add a link in the notes section or upload it below.

subSections.validationError: Please provide a name for your project
subSections.title: Project Name

questions.description: Can you provide a brief summary of the application you’d like to develop?
questions.title: App Summary

questions.validationError: Please let us know the target device
questions.title: App Type
questions.description: What type of application are we developing? Please                           place an X in the Required column for each required app                           type. Please note that each additional app type incurs                           a cost, but that the cost will be detailed and broken                           out in the final project proposal.

options.label: iOS App - An app built for iPhone or iPads
Android App - An app built for mobile phones or tablets running Android.
Hybrid App - An app built using a hybrid framework (ex. Ionic/Cordova/Xamarin) and exported to one or more operating systems (iOS, Android or both).
Mobile Web App - An app that is accessed by using a mobile web browser like Safari or Chrome.

questions.description: Please describe the ideal workflow for the proposed solution.
questions.title: Workflow

questions.description: What are the main business objectives you want to achieve by developing this application?
questions.title: Objectives
Form Factor/Orientation
questions.description: Please place an X in the Required column for each                            form factor/orientation that must be supported.

questions.title: Do you have a style guide or branding guidelines that need to be followed?
Are there any particular fonts you want used?
Are there any particular colors/themes you want used?
Do you need an app icon designed, or will you provide one?

subSections.title: User Roles
subSections.description: Please place an X in the Required column for each user type/role. Please provide details on what the user/role should do in the Description column.

questions.title: Standard User
Admin
Super Admin

subSections.title: Integrations
subSections.description: Will this application be dependant on data from another system or tool? If yes, please briefly describe that dependency here.  This can include integration with an API or an existing backend/database.

questions.title: API
Backend
Database
Screen / Feature List
questions.description: Please note that each added feature incurs a cost,                          but that the cost will be detailed and broken out in the                          final project proposal.

options.label: Enterprise Login - Supports integration with an existing authorization/authentication mechanism.
Email Login - Support sign in using an email address/password.
Social Login - Support register and login using third-party services such as Facebook, Twitter, and Google.
Registration - Allow users to register and login using their email address and a password. Users can also change their password or recover a forgotten one.
Invitations - Allow users to invite others to use your app via email.
Introductions - Present your app and inform users of core functionality using a series of introductory screens before they sign up.
Onboarding - Virtually walk your users through your application. This functionality is especially useful if you need new users to set up an account or express preferences after they sign up.

Search - Provide the ability to search your app for specific content, such as products, members, or locations. Please specify below if you also would like autocomplete--suggesting appropriate search terms as a user starts typing.

Location Based Services - App must support the identification of the users geographic location for location based features. Ex. show store locations on a map or illustrating the progress of a delivery.
Camera (Audio & Video) - Add this feature if your app will require using the camera to capture audio or video.
File Upload - Allow users to upload photos or other files.
Notifications - Take advantage of notifications; for example, remind users to do certain tasks or update them on new content.
Dashboard - App must have a central dashboard where users can access functionality
Tagging - Allow users to tag products, people or content; for example, in order to classify and easily retrieve notes.
Account Settings - Allow your users to adjust settings or specify preferences, such as communication frequency.
Help/FAQs - Include a section dedicated to FAQ or Help content.
Marketplace - Allow users to buy, sell, or rent products or services.
Ratings & Reviews - Let users rate or review people, products, or services.
Payments - Allow users to pay in some way; for example, using credit cards, PayPal, or Bitcoin.
Shopping Cart - Allow users to save items before purchasing. Please specify your desired functionality below.
Product Listing - Add this feature to shows lists of product or services, with individual detail pages for each one.
Activity Feed - Show your users an activity feed of some kind, as they’re used to seeing on Facebook and Twitter, for example.
Profiles - Add this feature if your app requires users to have a profile, including the ability to edit it.
Messaging - Allow direct communication between two or more users.
Admin Tool - App must have an administrative tool or panel to enable direct management of users, content and the application.
Social Media Integration - App must integrate with social media providers (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Google+, etc)
Reporting - App must have the ability to report/export data
Contact Us - App must have the ability to allow users to contact an administrator/send feedback to administrators.
3D Touch - If this is an iOS App -- should the designers make use of 3D Touch?

questions.title: Tech Features

options.label: SSO Integration - App must integrate with enterprise single-sign-on capability.
API Integration - App must integrate with a pre-existing API.
Third Party System Integration - App must integrate with an external application or system and either retrieve or post data.
Containerized Code - The codebase must be containerized via Docker to allow for easier deployment and maintenance.
Unit Tests - App must have unit tests to ensure code coverage.
Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment - Establishment of a CI/CD pipeline.
Analytics Implementation - Implementation of analytics to track user behavior and app usage.
Email (SMTP Server) Setup - Development and configuration of an SMTP server to provide email notifications. Design, content and development of the emails will need to be handled separately.
Offline Capability - Ability to use features of the application offline, and have the data persist/saved locally and then sent back to a server for syncing.
Minimal Battery Usage Implementation - Update to the core features of a mobile application to support the ability to minimize usage of network bandwidth and battery usage.
Apple App Store & Google Play Submission Support - Consulting support to help streamline the app publishing process to Apple App Store or Google Play.
SMS Gateway Integration - App must integrate with an external SMS gateway/provider for notifications via SMS.
Error Logging - Does the application need error logging (this will log all errors, exceptions, warnings, debug information during the application execution and will be helpful to rectify the issues)?
Face ID / Touch ID -- If this is an iOS App -- should we support Face ID/Touch ID for login

subSections.title: Technology Stack
subSections.description: Do you have a preferred technology stack? If yes, please list those requirements here:

questions.title: Programming Languages

Security Requirements

options.label: Enterprise - if your application will house                   or transmit PII or sensitive data. The data will be encrypted on the device and the server.
Vulnerability Scanning - Scan your application for weaknesses
Audit - Auditing will record user information on actions performed.
System will be working with confidential, health or financial records

questions.description: Please place an X in the Required column for each required security requirement.

questions.title: Quality Assurance, Test Data & Performance Testing
questions.description: Please place an X in the Required column for each required QA requirement.

options.label: Real World Unstructured - Users search on their own for bugs or usability issues.
Structured Functional - execution of predefined test scripts
Test Case Creation - creation of scenarios, instructions and exepected results
Certify your mobile application release against predefined device set including.
Test real devices in real cell networks across the world

questions.title: How many users do you intend to support?
Do you intend to supply test data or should Topcoder create it?

questions.description: UAT is the process of sharing the final application with users and gathering feedback. Please place an X in the Required column for each required UAT requirement.

options.label: Implementation of Updates (update the app based on UAT/Beta Testing feedback)

questions.description: Please describe all the primary screens first. It is important to think about the biggest        problem of your application, rather than list all possible screens. Well documented and        researched design patterns like "Settings", "Search", "Listing", "Log In", "Registration" do not need        to be the focus of the design, unless you're doing something transformative with said        screens. name: Real World Testing

questions.title: Real World Testing
questions.description: Please answer a few basic questions about your project. You can also provide the needed information in a supporting document--add a link in the notes section or upload it below.

subSections.validationError: Please provide a name to your project
subSections.title: Project Name

questions.validationError: Please let us know what kind of testing you would like to execute
questions.title: What kind of crowd testing are you interested in?
questions.description: Structured testing focuses on the execution of test cases, whereas unstructured testing lets the testers create their own path through an application as an end user might.

questions.validationError: Please let us know if you have test cases.
questions.title: Do you have test cases written?
questions.description: Do you have test cases you would like executed? These are essential when running structured testing and optional for unstructured testing. If you are planning a structured test cycle and do not have test cases do not worry, we can help!

options.label: No I do not have test cases.

questions.description: Brief Description
questions.title: Description
Please tell us about your users.
questions.description: Please share information about your end users. Where are they from? What is their goal? This information can help you find the best testers for your application.

questions.title: Which is your primary device target?
questions.description: Select only the device that you need to develop for.                           In most cases limiting the scope of your project would result                           in better final result. Topcoder recommends to always start                           with the mobile phone view and expand to other devices as your                           app matures.

subSections.title: Notes
subSections.description: Please enter any additional information like                       requirements and/or test cases.  After creating                        your project you will be able to upload files.

questions.title: Testing Needs
questions.description: Please answer these additional questions to better help us understand your needs.

questions.title: Please describe your website and/or application.
Please describe which features or components are in-scope in this testing effort.
Are any features or components out of scope? If yes, please describe.
Do you have a specific timeline for testing? If so, please provide approximate start and end dates.
Do you have preferred demographics you would like to target?
Would you like to target any specific geographies?
Are any specific skills required to test your application? If so, please list them.
Do you have a version of the application available for testers to access? If so, please provide details. Details can include a test URL, access information, etc.
Are any test assets available? For exmaple: test plan, test scenario, test scripts, test data.
Are there any other specific details related to the environment you can share?
Please describe your application.
Please list all platforms the application should be tested on.
Does the application require training to utilize it properly? If so, are you able to provide these inputs?
Would you like usability suggestions included in the issue report?
Are there any types of defects you would like ommitted from issue reports?

name: Performance Testing
details: Webpage rendering effiency, Load, Stress and Endurance Test

questions.title: Performance Testing
questions.description: Please answer a few basic questions about your project. You can also provide the needed information in a supporting document—add a link in the notes section or upload it below.

subSections.validationError: Please provide a name to your project
subSections.title: Project Name

questions.description: In 160 or more characters tell us what is the app, main functions, problem area, etc..
questions.title: Please provide brief description of the system and/or application you would like to execute Performance Testing on.
What is the desired load on the system in terms of concurrent users for this test?
questions.description: (Unit package includes 500 virtual users, additional load would require Top-Ups)
questions.validationError: Please provide expected load

questions.title: Approximately how many business processes/transactions will be included in your Performance Test?
questions.description: (Unit package covers 10 transactions, additional transactions would require Top-Ups)
questions.validationError: Please provide expected number of business processes

questions.title: How many hours do you expect the Performance Test to be executed for?
questions.description: (Unit package covers 10 hours of execution, additional execution time would require Top-Ups)
questions.validationError: Please provide expected hours of execution

questions.title: Please select any additional add-ons.

options.label: Precurser to purchase - 1 Tool, 2 scripts,1 hour execution

subSections.title: Notes
subSections.description: Please enter any additional information like                       requirements and/or test cases.  After creating                        your project you will be able to upload files.

questions.title: Points of Contacts
questions.description: Please provide information on specific points of contacts.

questions.title: Name of the Business SPOC
questions.validationError: Please provide name of business SPOC

questions.title: Email of the Business SPOC
Name of the Testing SPOC
questions.validationError: Please provide name of testing SPOC

questions.title: Email of the Testing SPOC
Name of the development SPOC
questions.validationError: Please provide name of development SPOC

questions.title: Email of the development SPOC
System Overview
questions.description: Please provide the overview of the system to be tested

questions.title: Briefly describe the architecture of the system. Please attach any architecture diagrams, design documents, and non-functional requirements in the Files section of this page.
What is the application development platform?
What is the front end of the system?
If applicable what web servers are used?
questions.description: (For eg. Webserver can be Apache, IIS etc.)

questions.title: If applicable what application servers are used?
questions.description: (For eg. Application server can be JBoss or Weblogic or Websphere etc.)

questions.title: What data store technology is used?
questions.description: (For eg. Back end can be Oracle, MS SQL or Sybase etc)

questions.title: If the back end is a legacy system then specify the below
questions.description: Mainframe(S390), AS400, Others

questions.title: What middleware is used, if any?
questions.description: (For eg. Middleware can be MQSeries or TIBCO or Webmethod etc)

questions.title: If your system uses web services, what architecture do they use? What functions do your web services perform?
questions.description: (For eg. SOAP/REST Webservices deployed in App server for new customer creation and maintenance)

questions.title: What is the authentication mode used by the application?
What interfaces does the application have?
Performance Test Environment
questions.description: Please provide information on test environments.

questions.title: Are the simulators/stubs available in test environment for the components available and if so do they support concurrent request simulation?
Will online interfaces/stubs for the payment systems, vendor systems etc. be available for performance testing?

Please provide details on test data availability -                     A) Resident or master test data in DB e.g. Customers, products, locations etc.                    B) User specific data e.g. User Ids, email, credit card, order number etc.                    Who will support creating/importing/masking test data?
Please let us know if SOA based services need to be performance tested in a stand alone manner. If yes, please provide relevant details

questions.description: Are the applications hosted on physical servers or virtual/cloud infrastructure
questions.title: Where are applications hosted?

Are performance testing tools available within your organization?                     (e.g. HP Loadrunner, Performance Center, Jmeter) If yes, has a PoC                     been conducted to validate the compatibility of these tools with the                     application to be tested? Will these be tools be made available in with                     required license for this performance test?

Are performance diagnostic tools available within your organization?             (e.g. Dynatrace, Yourkit, Profiler) If yes, has a PoC been conducted to validate             compatibility ofthese tools with the applicationto be tested? Will these be tools             be made available in with required license for this performance test?
How is application performance being monitored or planned to be monitored in production.            Are same tools available in testing environment?

In case of cloud based or SaaS performance testing tools, will your organization open necessary                     ports in any firewalls required to inject load on the application in a test environment?
Previous Performance Test Details
questions.description: Please provide information on specific points of contacts.

questions.title: When was the last time performance test carried out? On which version of application code base?
Please share the previous performance test reports if available by pasting here, or attaching in the Files section.
What are the changes in application, architecture, infrastructure since the last test?
What different types of tests were carried out and which measurements were captured?
What were the performance testing and performance monitoring tools used?
Are the performance test scenarios and automated test scripts previously used still available?
Are there any open performance issues from previous tests?
Please detail any issues previously identified and resolved from previous performance tests.

name: Health Security Check
details: Measure your code base against our security baseline using the crowd and tooling

questions.title: Health Security Check
questions.description: Topcoder will scan your application using our properiatary formula    for security standards. questions.title: Salesforce Accelerator
questions.description: Please answer a few basic questions about your project and, as an option,                  add links to supporting documents in the “Notes” section.                                    *AssureNXT - Rapid Test Design Module is a Component of AssureNXT which is a Test Management Platform.                  It helps in Automated Test Case and Test Data Model generation through business process diagrams.                  RTD establishes direct relationship between business requirements, process flows and test coverage.                  Accelerated Test Case generation for changed business process.                                    *Tosca - Tricentis Tosca is a testing tool that is used to automate end-to-end testing for software applications.                  Tricentis Tosca combines multiple aspects of software testing (test case design, test automation, test data design                   and generation, and analytics) to test GUIs and APIs from a business perspective
